Human.description: Born after the Fall, carrying the Breath of the Maker, a divine spark against the Veil’s corruption.
Human.lore: Humans wield divine power, feared by demons, coveted by elves, harvested by dwarves. Their versatility is their strength. Male Breath magic counters corruption; females risk Veil’s chaos.

abilities.name: Breath of the Maker
abilities.description: Male-only and conditional: requires a Breath-bound class AND Virtue ≥ 70. Breath powers awaken only against abominations. +5 resistance to Veil corruption.

abilities.name: Aegis of the Word (conditional)
abilities.description: While Virtue ≥ 70 AND target is an abomination: −20% Veil/fear effects taken.

abilities.name: Sanctified Steel (conditional)
abilities.description: While Virtue ≥ 70 AND target is an abomination: +15% weapon damage and +10 armor penetration.

Elf.description: Immortal heirs of Eve, agile and perceptive, wielding Veil magic at corruption’s cost.
Elf.lore: Elves weave mystical armor and master ranged combat in twilight forests, using humans to offload Veil’s taint. Female Veil mages face corruption and sterility risks.

abilities.name: Eagle-Eye Vision
abilities.description: +15 perception for long-distance sight. +5 ranged attack accuracy with bows or throwing weapons.

Dwarf.description: Dense, resilient sons of Adam, forged in high-gravity holds, wielding axes and gunpowder.
Dwarf.lore: Dwarves craft rune-forged relics and reject elven blades; their females carve sacred runes in stone cities, but dwarves wield no active Breath.

abilities.name: Stone Resilience
abilities.description: Reduce blunt/slash damage by 10%. +10 Veil resistance.

abilities.name: Dark Adaptation
abilities.description: +10 perception in low light. Torches extend vision 20% farther.

notes.origin: Kha'inic line (Qayin) - earth-bound, marked, barred from Breath.
notes.aging: Ageless (do not senesce). Deepcall draws elders into the strata over centuries.
notes.caps_reminder: See rules/stats.json Dwarf_Male for species caps (STR 60 / TGH 60 / END 60).

Ogre.description: Manufactured giants, twisted from boys into 600 kg brutes with childlike minds, built for war and logistics.
Ogre.lore: Ogres wield improvised weapons, crushing foes with bear-like mass. Designed for war’s burdens—carrying supplies, enduring slaughter—their childlike minds shrug off trauma but crave open spaces. In Cursed Swamps, they consume tainted meat (+corruption); Dark Elves exploit their hunger. Claustrophobia keeps them from cities, favoring open battlefields or gate entries.

abilities.name: Titanic Might
abilities.description: +20% melee damage. Ignore 10 armor. +20 grappling/knockback checks.

abilities.name: Thickskin
abilities.description: Damage reduction of 6 for blunt/slashing damage.

abilities.name: Berserk Rage
abilities.description: At 10% HP, +15 attack bonus, -20 accuracy penalty, ignore stamina limits, 5% collapse risk per round, double bleeding damage.

abilities.name: Claustrophobia
abilities.description: In tight spaces, difficulty 25 check every 10 seconds; fail deals 10 blunt damage to surroundings, 3 fails attacks allies; fear intensity 8. Avoid indoor spaces; prefer open areas—no interest in cities/houses/castles unless open-gate entry.

abilities.name: High Caloric Need & Fast Healing
abilities.description: Require 6000 calories daily; hunger may trigger cannibalistic desperation (10% chance to attack ally for 20 damage, rip limb); heal 50% faster for non-severed wounds as long as fed.

abilities.name: Logistics Beast
abilities.description: Carry 3x normal weight without encumbrance penalties (gear/food/equipment). Built for war logistics—transport supplies effortlessly.

abilities.name: Childlike Mind
abilities.description: Immune to war trauma/stress (no morale penalties from bloodshed/combat; mind like 6-8 year-old—simple, unaffected by horror).
